oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from John A. Crutchfield to Mrs. L. M. Crutchfield describing Forrest's 1864 actions in Mississippi
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Letter from 1st Lt. John A. Crutchfield, Co. F, 20th (Russell's) Tenn. Cav. Regt., part of Nathan Bedford Forrest's command in northern Mississippi in "Camp Near Oxford, Miss." Crutchfield states that "the Yanks have all gone back to Memphis" after two recent engagements just north of Oxford, involving N. B. Forrest, the Kentucky Bde., Chalmers' Bde., and Mabry's Brigade.
